snippet: The most potent challenge to America’s dominance comes not from the continuing redistribution of global power, but from the new forms of governance and capitalism being forged by China and other rising nations.
abstract: Op-Ed article by Charles A Kupchan, professor of international relations, asserts that the most potent challenge to America's dominance in the world comes from new forms of governance and capitalism being forged by China and other rising nations; submits that if American leaders recognize that there are alternative forms of responsible and responsive government, it would would elevate America's moral authority.
lead_paragraph: The most potent challenge to America’s dominance comes not from the continuing redistribution of global power, but from the new forms of governance and capitalism being forged by China and other rising nations.

headline.main: America’s Place in the New World
headline.print_headline: America’s Place in the New World
